issue.title: gplinks.co
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://gplinks.co/iQZXFEy](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgplinks.co%2FiQZXFEy)
### Comment
> It seems that the mechanism requires clicking the ad and waiting for 15 seconds to verify, as stated in "Click ad and wait for 15 seconds on ad to Verify." However, the ads are delivered by Google, and they disappear not only through DNS blocking but also with the AdGuard app on iOS. Therefore, it is impossible to bypass this system, which is a drawback of AdGuard. I understand that addressing issues through DNS is challenging, but is there any way to make it functional with AdGuard for iOS?
> 
> Thank you for your help.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/jol51rr15ugccos0w8k80o0swcco8o8lt977o3cyr4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2o08l1g80qo0g8ksgossks8o0o8g0w8ltd4zlrbybk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

issue.title: mega-enlace.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.3.13

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

mega-enlace.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

broken link shortener with AdGuard enabled: `mega-enlace.com`

I won't post an example link, because it only works when you arrive at the link shortener coming from one of the sites that use it. _(If you go to the link shortener directly it just redirects to google.com)_

Sites that use it:  (Spanish downloads sites)
```
https://pelisenhd.org/
https://www.latinomegahd.net/
https://gatonplayseries.com/
https://www.peliculasgd.net/
https://www.tododvdfull.com/
```

The main issue seems to be that this link shortener site forces you to click on some ads to move forward. But those ads are blocked by AdGuard.

_note: this link shortener site seems to save your IP address to grant you access for 24h to the downloads, once you complete the steps. This access permission is independent for each of the movie websites._

the link shortener uses these auxiliary domains: 
`todoandroid.live|gadgetzona.net|freeserverhostingweb.club|qwanturankpro.com|notipostingt.com`
`todoandroid.live,gadgetzona.net,freeserverhostingweb.club,qwanturankpro.com,notipostingt.com`
It is in these domains where the ads should show up, so we can click them. But they are blocked, so I can't move forward through the link shortener.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:

issue.title: mega-enlace.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.3.13

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

mega-enlace.com

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

broken link shortener with AdGuard enabled: `mega-enlace.com`

I won't post an example link, because it only works when you arrive at the link shortener coming from one of the sites that use it. _(If you go to the link shortener directly it just redirects to google.com)_

Sites that use it:  (Spanish downloads sites)
```
https://pelisenhd.org/
https://www.latinomegahd.net/
https://gatonplayseries.com/
https://www.peliculasgd.net/
https://www.tododvdfull.com/
```

The main issue seems to be that this link shortener site forces you to click on some ads to move forward. But those ads are blocked by AdGuard.

_note: this link shortener site seems to save your IP address to grant you access for 24h to the downloads, once you complete the steps. This access permission is independent for each of the movie websites._

the link shortener uses these auxiliary domains: 
`todoandroid.live|gadgetzona.net|freeserverhostingweb.club|qwanturankpro.com|notipostingt.com`
`todoandroid.live,gadgetzona.net,freeserverhostingweb.club,qwanturankpro.com,notipostingt.com`
It is in these domains where the ads should show up, so we can click them. But they are blocked, so I can't move forward through the link shortener.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I have added `neworldtravel.com` to current rules.
If you use AdGuard app or MV2 extension in Chromium based browser, then filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.
In the case of MV3 and Firefox extension, new JS rule will be available in one of the next extension updates.

issue.title: defencedev.com cookie consent, unable to hide it
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

The cookie consent on a https://defencedev.com/solutions/timeshift-create-restore-snapshots/ seems not to be easy to dismiss/not consent.

Blocking manually:

defencedev.com##.fc-dialog-container
defencedev.com##.fc-dialog-overlay
defencedev.com##.fc-consent-root

prevents webpage scrolling on Firefox-ESR.

-

issue.title: gplinks.co

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://gplinks.co/iQZXFEy](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgplinks.co%2FiQZXFEy)
### Comment
> It seems that the mechanism requires clicking the ad and waiting for 15 seconds to verify, as stated in "Click ad and wait for 15 seconds on ad to Verify." However, the ads are delivered by Google, and they disappear not only through DNS blocking but also with the AdGuard app on iOS. Therefore, it is impossible to bypass this system, which is a drawback of AdGuard. I understand that addressing issues through DNS is challenging, but is there any way to make it functional with AdGuard for iOS?
> 
> Thank you for your help.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/jol51rr15ugccos0w8k80o0swcco8o8lt977o3cyr4.jpg?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2o08l1g80qo0g8ksgossks8o0o8g0w8ltd4zlrbybk.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | `iOS 18.5`
Browser: | Safari

comment.body:
> but is there any way to make it functional with AdGuard for iOS?

AdGuard for iOS should help. Note that `advanced protection` must be enabled. I've also updated the rules, it should be available in 2-3 hours.

### Comment
> It seems that the mechanism requires clicking the ad and waiting for 15 seconds to verify, as stated in "Click ad and wait for 15 seconds on ad to Verify." However, the ads are delivered by Google, and they disappear not only through DNS blocking but also with the AdGuard app on iOS. Therefore, it is impossible to bypass this system, which is a drawback of AdGuard. I understand that addressing issues through DNS is challenging, but is there any way to make it functional with AdGuard for iOS?

issue.title: www.aboutamazon.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/retail/prime-day-2025-todays-big-deals-day-1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aboutamazon.com%2Fnews%2Fretail%2Fprime-day-2025-todays-big-deals-day-1) ### Comment > Hi. I don't know much of anything about ad blocking. The form I filled out was to the best of my ability. It may contain errors. The situation: I was on Google News (not signed in and never going there again). When I navigated between the business and technology tabs, instead of proceeding to the selected tab, this website popped up. There were no links on either page at the time that I could have hit accidentally to get there as far as I can tell. It happened once and I got aggravated, so I ignored it and clicked onward. The second time it happened, I informed not just AdGuard, but also Bitdefender and Vivaldi. Only AdGuard reached out. I can't reproduce the event. I don't think it's a missed ad; I think it was purposefully injected into the transition between tabs to avoid AdGuard or Vivaldi blocking it. I don't have any clue or ability to figure this situation out, but something like an injection in between two selected webpages is highly suspect. I don't know if it is something AdGuard, Vivaldi, and/or Bitdefender have anything to do with, so no judgment. I enjoy using AdGuard and Vivaldi both. This isn't a complaint in any way. I just wanted to inform everyone that I saw this happen and if it's important, it's here for you to take a look at it. Thank you so much for your help! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/qxojokhhhpwcwwwksgcg40wg4sccww8tvw1q6r75k0.jpg?nc=1)

issue.title: defencedev.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

The cookie consent on a https://defencedev.com/solutions/timeshift-create-restore-snapshots/ seems not to be easy to dismiss/not consent.

Blocking manually:

defencedev.com##.fc-dialog-container
defencedev.com##.fc-dialog-overlay
defencedev.com##.fc-consent-root

prevents webpage scrolling on Firefox-ESR.

-

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
